Line Maintenance Engineer Job at Green Africa Airways Limited




        
    

        
        Green Africa Airways Limited is a value airline based in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a new carrier that offers safe, reliable and affordable air travel to a much broader group of customers. This positions us as a significant contributor to the economic development of Nigeria and the African continent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Line Maintenance Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Role
     

            
    




	Perform daily inspection and all required checks prior to release of aircraft to service
	Meticulously Carry out all assigned routine maintenance tasks as stipulated in work instructions issued by Green Africa Engineering and CAMO unit within allowed time frame
	Ensure compliance with Green Africa’s procedures/control manuals and applicable regulations (e.g., Nig. CARs) in all maintenance activities
	Report, trouble shoot and rectify aircraft and aircraft component defect and deficiencies in accordance with Green Africa’s procedures, manufacturer’s manuals, and NCAA regulations
	Reporting defects and deficiencies of facilities, tools, and equipment in accordance with Green Africa’s procedures, control manuals and NCAA regulations
	Maintain workplace cleanliness
	Place order for supplies, parts, tools, equipment, and materials required for maintenance activities (especially unscheduled tasks) 
	Promote safety within the workplace
	Ensure proper recording of work performed, part changes etc in accordance with Green Africa’s procedures and in compliance with NCAA regulations
	Ensure that all tools, equipment, and materials collected for the accomplishment of tasks are duly accounted for after completion of work but prior to release of aircraft for flight


Qualifications


	Aircraft Maintenance Engineer (AME) license with airframe and powerplant ratings or Avionics rating/ EASA or FAA license holder with Validation certificate from NCAA 
	Five (5) years relevant experience in maintaining ATR 72- 600 
	Served as a certifying engineer for at least three (3) years on type
	Trained on ATR 72- 600 engine run up with at least 2 years of experience
	Have a good knowledge of maintenance contracts, manufacturer’s manuals (AIPC, MMEL and MEL, FIM, SRM etc) and their usage
	Possess a good knowledge of NCAA regulations 
	Excellent knowledge of aircraft systems
	Excellent defect trouble shooting and rectification skills
	Thorough knowledge of maintenance planning, along with management oversight of inspections, repairs, and modifications
	Possess a good knowledge of the inter-relationship between various departments in an airline
	Good communication skills and must be computer literate
	Use of a maintenance software is an added advantage.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales and Marketing Manager",
  "description": "GTI Microfinance Limited was incorporated in August 2007 as a limited liability company and started its operations in 2008 at No. 127 Obafemi Awolowo Road, Ikeja.

In October 2013, it was licensed as a State Wide Microfinance Bank and moved its Head Office to No. 4 Tinubu Street, Central Business District, Marina Lagos. Other branches are located at Mushin, Abattoir in Agege, Surulere and Arena.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Sales and Marketing Manager will be responsible for driving business growth, overseeing loan processing, and ensuring the financial soundness of the branch&rsquo;s credit portfolio.
	This role involves supervising subordinates, evaluating loan applications, deposit mobilization, mitigating risks, and fostering strong customer relationships.
	The ideal candidate must have a proven track record in microfinance lending, loan recovery, and risk management.


Responsibilities


	Coordinate, supervise, market loan products and process loan applications for Customers
	Oversee subordinates and evaluate loan processing to determine customers financial eligibility and feasibility of repayment of loans
	Determine all applicable ratios and metrics and set up loan payment plans
	Complete loan contracts and counsel clients on policies and restrictions
	Opening loan applications conducting loan analysis by visiting the business and household of clients
	Visiting the business /employer of guarantors and preparing a complete loan assessment according to the bank&rsquo;s credit procedures
	Presenting loan proposals to the credit units and informing the client about the decision of the credit units
	Ensuring punctual repayments of acquired loans from clients, contacting and visiting all parties based on needs
	Ensuring high quality standards of the bank&rsquo;s credit portfolio
	Ability to meet and exceed targets while actively working to increasing business portfolio and clients&#39; base.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in a relevant field of study or relevant professional qualification would be an advantage
	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in financial services.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a managerial positionpaticularly ina microfinance bank.
	Good interpersonal skills with strong verbal and written communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;career@gti.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Sales and Marketing Manager Job at GTI Microfinance Bank




        
    

        
        GTI Microfinance Limited was incorporated in August 2007 as a limited liability company and started its operations in 2008 at No. 127 Obafemi Awolowo Road, Ikeja.

In October 2013, it was licensed as a State Wide Microfinance Bank and moved its Head Office to No. 4 Tinubu Street, Central Business District, Marina Lagos. Other branches are located at Mushin, Abattoir in Agege, Surulere and Arena.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales and Marketing Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Sales and Marketing Manager will be responsible for driving business growth, overseeing loan processing, and ensuring the financial soundness of the branch’s credit portfolio.
	This role involves supervising subordinates, evaluating loan applications, deposit mobilization, mitigating risks, and fostering strong customer relationships.
	The ideal candidate must have a proven track record in microfinance lending, loan recovery, and risk management.


Responsibilities


	Coordinate, supervise, market loan products and process loan applications for Customers
	Oversee subordinates and evaluate loan processing to determine customers financial eligibility and feasibility of repayment of loans
	Determine all applicable ratios and metrics and set up loan payment plans
	Complete loan contracts and counsel clients on policies and restrictions
	Opening loan applications conducting loan analysis by visiting the business and household of clients
	Visiting the business /employer of guarantors and preparing a complete loan assessment according to the bank’s credit procedures
	Presenting loan proposals to the credit units and informing the client about the decision of the credit units
	Ensuring punctual repayments of acquired loans from clients, contacting and visiting all parties based on needs
	Ensuring high quality standards of the bank’s credit portfolio
	Ability to meet and exceed targets while actively working to increasing business portfolio and clients' base.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant field of study or relevant professional qualification would be an advantage
	Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in financial services.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a managerial positionpaticularly ina microfinance bank.
	Good interpersonal skills with strong verbal and written communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career@gti.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Senior Accountant Job at D.light Energy Limited




        
    

        
        D.light Energy Limited is a Renewable Energy company specialized in providing efficient and affordable electricity at different scale. We meet the electricity needs of household and all strata of businesses through our Pay as you go structure, improving quality of life and providing access to 24/7 electricity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Senior Accountant to join our Finance team.
	This role is responsible for the timely preparation of monthly management accounts, budgeting, variance and cost analysis, and reconciliation of financial and cost accounts.
	The ideal candidate will provide critical insights to support strategic decision-making and ensure robust financial control within the business.


 Key Responsibilities
Budgeting & Variance Analysis:


	Assist in preparing accurate budgets, ensuring spending aligns with board-approved plans and OPEX/revenue targets.
	Prepare monthly and quarterly business review reports, MIS, and OPEX reports for Nigeria with precision and timeliness.
	Manage and forecast cash flow, ensuring liquidity and optimal fund utilization.


Commercial Support & Business Partnering:


	Collaborate closely with the Managing Director and business units to provide strategic financial support.
	Enhance visibility into cost accounting, project margin analysis, value chains, and other critical financial metrics.
	Analyze financial data to identify unusual trends and provide actionable insights.


Financial Reporting & Compliance:


	Support the Finance Manager in finalizing financial statements and conducting in-depth analytical reviews.
	Ensure robust financial controls are in place and are functioning effectively.
	Oversee the Order-to-Cash (O2C) cycle, ensuring accurate transaction recording and control implementation.
	Provide visibility into inventory positions through timely management reporting.
	Lead and support accurate and timely month-end, quarter-end, and year-end closing processes.
	Manage and close all statutory, tax, external, and internal audits, addressing audit queries effectively.
	Ensure compliance with local IFRS and US GAAP accounting standards.


Qualifications & Experience


	Qualified Chartered Accountant with strong business acumen.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in Budgeting, Cost Accounting, and Financial Reporting, preferably in FMCG or similar industries.
	Hands-on experience in MIS reporting, compliance, and commercial finance activities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Business Central (MBC). Experience with Vena or Tableau is an added advantage.


Key Competencies:


	Behavioral Competencies
	Strong communication skills and ability to influence stakeholders.
	High level of attention to detail and accuracy.
	Strong outcome orientation with a focus on delivering results.


Functional Competencies:


	Expertise in budgeting, variance analysis, and FP&A.
	Strong skills in MIS reporting and financial analysis.
	Solid understanding of ERP systems (Microsoft Business Central, Vena, Tableau).

Job Purpose


	We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Executive Assistant with the potential to grow into a CEO role.
	This individual will be responsible for a wide range of tasks, including managing key business operations, financial reporting, relationship management, and strategic business development.
	The right candidate will have the opportunity to work closely with senior leadership and be groomed for future leadership roles.

Key Responsibilities


	Currency Swaps &amp; Treasury Management: Support and manage currency swaps and the sale of treasury products, ensuring optimal financial management.
	Business Development &amp; Relationship Management: Act as a point of contact for high-level executives and key stakeholders, maintaining and strengthening business relationships.

	Target Setting &amp; Achievement: Set clear targets and budgets (recommend a yearly budget for approval) for various business functions, seek approval from leadership, and take full responsibility for achieving the agreed-upon numbers within set timelines.

	Strong organizational skills to set, manage, and achieve targets and budgets.

	Regulatory Engagement: Ability to effectively interact with financial regulators, including FIRS and CBN, and ensure compliance with regulations.
	Licensing &amp; Expansion: Ability to navigate the procurement of new licenses and understand the skills needed to support business growth and development.


Personal Attributes:


	High degree of professionalism and confidentiality.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks efficiently.
	Adaptable and eager to learn and grow within the organization.
	Highly flexible and able to work under varying conditions with a proactive mindset.


Terms of Employment


	Salary: Competitive salary, commensurate with experience.
	Career Growth: The potential for promotion to executive leadership roles, including Director, based on performance.
